Any.description:
`Any` contains an arbitrary serialized message along with a
URL that describes the type of the serialized message

@type.description: A URL/resource name that uniquely identifies the type of the serialized message.

CheckLivenessResponseServingState.description:
The state.

 - SERVING_STATE_UNSPECIFIED: SERVING_STATE_UNSPECIFIED
 - SERVING_STATE_SERVING: SERVING_STATE_SERVING
 - SERVING_STATE_NOT_SERVING: SERVING_STATE_NOT_SERVING
 - SERVING_STATE_SERVICE_UNKNOWN: SERVING_STATE_SERVICE_UNKNOWN

rpcStatus.description:
The `Status` type defines a logical error model that is suitable for
different programming environments, including REST APIs and RPC APIs. It is
used by [gRPC](https://github.com/grpc). Each `Status` message contains
three pieces of data: error code, error message, and error details.

You can find out more about this error model and how to work with it in the
[API Design Guide](https://cloud.google.com/apis/design/errors).

code.description: The status code, which should be an enum value of [google.rpc.Code][google.rpc.Code].

message.description:
A developer-facing error message, which should be in English. Any
user-facing error message should be localized and sent in the
[google.rpc.Status.details][google.rpc.Status.details] field, or localized by the client.

details.description:
A list of messages that carry the error details.  There is a common set of
message types for APIs to use.

v1AssetMaster.description:
- ASSET_MASTER_UNSPECIFIED: UNSPECIFIED
 - ASSET_MASTER_BARRA: BARRA
 - ASSET_MASTER_BLOOMBERG: BLOOMBERG
 - ASSET_MASTER_FACTSET: FACTSET
 - ASSET_MASTER_REFINITIVE: REFINITIVE
 - ASSET_MASTER_SNP: SNP
v1AssetMaster.title: Set of enums for representing AssetMaster

v1CancellationReason.description:
- CANCELLATION_REASON_UNSPECIFIED: Default value
 - CANCELLATION_REASON_REQ_REJECTION: Cancelled due to service restart
 - CANCELLATION_REASON_EXHAUSTION_OF_ALLOTTED_TIME: Cancelled due to exhaustion of alotted time
 - CANCELLATION_REASON_CAPACITY_EXHAUSTION: Cancelled due to capacity exhaustion
 - CANCELLATION_REASON_RESOURCE_UNAVAILABILITY: Cancelled due to unavailabity of resource
 - CANCELLATION_REASON_RETRY_EXCEEDED: Cancelled due to retry exceeded
v1CancellationReason.title: Reason for cancel

v1EntityResolutionMetadata.title: EntityResolutionMetadata represents operational metadata for a entity resolution LRO

interactiveResolutionResponse.title: Parameters for interactive entity resolution response

fileResolutionResponse.title: Parameters for file entity resolution response

tableResolutionResponse.title: Parameters for table entity resolution response

v1FileEntityResolutionParam.description:
FileEntityResolutionParam represents parameters for resolving the entity column
present inside the file.

fileName.title: name of the file to be resolved

fileHeaders.title: column names of data in file

fieldEnclosedCharacter.title: character field is enclosed by if any

myDateFormat.title: specific date format. default is auto

myTimeFormat.title: specific time format. default is auto

myTimestampFormat.title: specific timestamp format. default is auto

nullIf.title: values that should be set to null. default is \\n NULL

uid.title: unique identifier to resolve input request to output response

entityCol.title: column name of the entity to be resolved

asofDateCol.title: column name of the asof dt

topRecordsCount.title: num of records to return for each name

assetMaster.title: asset master. e.g. bbg, barra, refinitive etc

modelName.title: name of the model used for resolving

v1FileEntityResolutionResponse.title: The response message for Entity FileResolution

topRecordsCount.title: count of records to return for each name

assetMaster.title: asset master. e.g. bbg, barra, refinitive etc

modelName.title: name of the model used for resolving

v1InteractiveEntityResolutionRequest.title: Request for resolution of an entity

uid.title: unique identifier to map input request to output response

asofDate.title: date on which the name should be resolved

yearFounded.title: year on which the entity was founded

phoneNumber.title: phone number of the enitity to be resolved

address.title: physical address of the enitity to be resolved

cityName.title: city of the enitity to be resolved

zipcode.title: zipcode of the entity to be resolved

stateName.title: state of the entity to be resolved

countryName.title: country of the entity to be resolved

v1InteractiveEntityResolutionResponse.title: Parameters for interactive entity resolution response

uid.description: unique identifier to resolve input request to outout response.

linkCount.description: num of resolutions for the given entity.

entityValueType.description: type of resolved entity. e.g. name, person, brand etc.

entityUid.description: permanent resolution identifier based on the src provided in the request.

confidenceScore.description: level of confidence behind the match.

v1LongrunningOperation.description:
LongrunningOperation represents a long-running operation that is the result
of a network API call.

id.description:
The server-assigned id, which is only unique within the same service that
originally returns it. If you use the default HTTP mapping, the
`id` should have the format of `operations/some/unique/id`.

meta.description:
Service-specific metadata associated with the operation.  It typically
contains progress information and common metadata such as create time.
Some services might not provide such metadata.  Any method that returns a
long-running operation should document the metadata type, if any.

done.description:
If the value is `false`, it means the operation is still in progress.
If true, the operation is completed, and either `error` or `response` is
available.

error.description: The error result of the operation in case of failure or cancellation.

response.description:
The normal response of the operation in case of success.  If the original
method returns no data on success, such as `Delete`, the response is
`google.protobuf.Empty`.  If the original method is standard
`Get`/`Create`/`Update`, the response should be the resource.  For other
methods, the response should have the type `XxxResponse`, where `Xxx`
is the original method name.  For example, if the original method name
is `TakeSnapshot()`, the inferred response type is
`TakeSnapshotResponse`.

snfRole.title: Role to use for snowflake session

snfWarehouse.title: Warehouse to use for snowflake session

snfDatabase.title: Database to use for snowflake session

snfSchema.title: Schema to use for snowflake session

v1TableEntityResolutionParam.description:
TableEntityResolutionParam represents parameters for resolving an entire entity column
present inside the src table.

srcTable.title: name of the fully qualified table

entityCol.title: column name of the entity to be resolved

asofDateCol.title: column name of the asof dt

resolvingKeyCol.title: column name where resolving value will be inserted

topRecordsCount.title: num of records to return for each name

assetMaster.title: asset master. e.g. bbg, barra, refinitive etc

modelName.title: name of the model used for resolving

uid.title: unique identifier to map input request to output response

v1TableEntityResolutionResponse.title: The response message for Entity Table Resolution

OAuth2AccessCode.description: This API uses OAuth 2.0 with the access code flow.

scopes.investment_research.data_services.asset_: This grants access to all endpoints in the investment_research.data_services.asset_resolution.v1.EntityResolution API
scopes.offline_access: This keeps you signed in to the app, even when you are not using it.

OAuth2ClientCredentials.description: This API uses OAuth 2.0 with the client credentials flow.

scopes.investment_research.data_services.asset_: This grants access to all endpoints in the investment_research.data_services.asset_resolution.v1.EntityResolution API
scopes.offline_access: This keeps you signed in to the app, even when you are not using it.
